unnormalised: So, someone asked me about the average cost of property in Bangalore, and honestly, it’s a tricky question. It really depends on where exactly you’re looking. Like, a 2BHK in Koramangala can easily set you back ₹80 lakhs - ₹1.2 crores. Meanwhile, you might find something similar a bit further out, say, near Whitefield, for maybe ₹65 lakhs. And then there's the whole GST thing to factor in… that adds another 5% or so, right? Plus, registration charges and all that jazz.
normalised: So, someone asked me about the average cost of property in Bangalore, and honestly, it's a tricky question. It really depends on where exactly you're looking. Like, a two B-H-K in Koramangala can easily set you back rupee eighty lakhs to one point two crores. Meanwhile, you might find something similar a bit further out, say, near Whitefield, for maybe sixty five lakhs. And then there's the whole G-S-T thing to factor in… that adds another five percent or so, right? Plus, registration charges and all that jazz.

unnormalised: My cousin, Priya, was looking to buy a place near her office in Electronic City last year. She had a budget of around Rs 50 lakh. After searching for what felt like forever, she finally found a decent 1BHK apartment listed at 48 lakhs. Of course, there were "other charges" on top of that – stamp duty, registration, brokerage fees – ended up costing her about Rs. 3 lakhs extra. So, all in, the place cost her Rs. 51 lakhs.
normalised: My cousin, Priya, was looking to buy a place near her office in Electronic City last year. She had a budget of around rupees fifty lakh. After searching for what felt like forever, she finally found a decent one B-H-K apartment listed at forty eight lakhs. Of course, there were "other charges" on top of that – stamp duty, registration, brokerage fees – ended up costing her about rupees three lakhs extra. So, all in, the place cost her rupees fifty one lakhs.

unnormalised: Moral of the story? Property prices in Bangalore are all over the place. Do your research, factor in all the hidden costs, and don't be afraid to bargain! And remember to check the RERA registration no. before you pay any token amount, heard too many fraud stories lately. Good luck finding your dream home!
normalised: Moral of the story? Property prices in Bangalore are all over the place. Do your research, factor in all the hidden costs, and don't be afraid to bargain! And remember to check the R-E-R-A registration number before you pay any token amount, heard too many fraud stories lately. Good luck finding your dream home!
